metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1079 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. A use-after-free may be triggered inasus_kbd_backlight_set when plugging/disconnecting in a malicious USBdevice, which advertises itself as an Asus device. Similarly to theprevious known CVE-2023-25012, but in asus devices, the work_struct may bescheduled by the LED controller while the device is disconnecting,triggering a use-after-free on the struct asus_kbd_leds *led structure. Amalicious USB device may exploit the issue to cause memory corruption withcontrolled data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1079` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
